a.span: Annual Notifications for Parents and Students

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.h1: COVID-19 School Closure/Cierre de la Escuela

div.span: Santa Clara County has made the decision to close all schools through the end of the school year, as a preventative measure to stop the spread of COVID19.

div.div: We recognize that this is an unprecedented time and recognize that this may impact your family. We continue to be committed to your childs education and growth during this trying time and will be sending ongoing communications and resources.

div.strong: If you haven't already done so, please update your contact information by filling in this form athttps://permission.click/AYbVz/usso that you will receive up to date communications from the district and your child's school.

div.div: The leadership team in Sunnyvale has prioritized developing plans in the following two areas to support your child/ren and family:
Five sites will be open for a free combined breakfast, lunch, and dinner pick up (not for onsite eating).
Please help us to encourage families to come by Bishop, Lakewood, San Miguel, Vargas, or Columbia Middle.

div.span: The District strongly encourages all families to have their child(ren) participate in the assignedlessons and classroom activities. Instruction will be for the purpose of moving students learning forward and although feedback will be provided, the assignments will not be graded.
Regularly scheduled assessments, including State Testing (CAASPP), and ELPAC (English Language Proficiency Assessment for California) will not be administered during this time.
If you need devices and Internet access please email

a.style: background-color: #ffffff; font-family: Arial; font-size: 12pt; color: #ad0304; box-sizing: border-box; text-decoration-line: none;

div.div: Check out our optional Spring Break adventure put together by our very own Educational Services Department here:bit.ly/SESDspringbreak

El condado de Santa Clara tom la decisin de cerrar todas las escuelas hasta el final del ao escolar como medida preventiva para detener la propagacin de COVID19. Reconocemos que este es un momento sin precedentes y reconocemos que esto puede afectar a su familia. Continuamos comprometidos con la educacin y el crecimiento de su hijo durante este perodo de prueba y enviaremos comunicaciones y recursos continuos.

strong.span: Si an no lo ha hecho, actualice su informacin de contacto completando este formulario en
para que reciba comunicaciones actualizadas del distrito y la escuela de su hijo.

div.div: El equipo de liderazgo del Distrito de Sunnyvale ha priorizado desarrollar planes concretos en las siguientes dos reas para apoyar a su estudiante y su familia.

SSD est trabajando en la apertura de 5 sitios escolares para proveer desayuno, almuerzo, y la cenagratis a nuestras familias. El servicio de desayuno y almuerzo comenzara lunes 16 de marzo. Este servicio ser continuo de lunes a viernes de las 11 am a 1 pm.
Las cinco escuelas que estarn abiertas ofreciendo el servicio de alimentos son Bishop, Lakewood, San Miguel, Vargas, y Columbia Middle School.

El Distrito alienta encarecidamente a todas las familias a que sus hijos participen en las lecciones asignadas y las actividades del aula. La instruccin tendr el propsito de hacer avanzar el aprendizaje de los estudiantes y, aunque se proporcionarn comentarios, las tareas no sern calificadas.
Las evaluaciones programadas regularmente, incluidas las Pruebas estatales (CAASPP) y ELPAC (Evaluacin de dominio del idioma ingls para California) no se administrarn durante este tiempo.
Si necesita dispositivos y acceso a Internet, enve un correo electrnico acovid19concerns@sesd.orgo llame al 408-522-8200 ext. 1107.

strong.a: Formulario de solicitud de soportetcnico para padres/tutores/estudiantes

div.span: Echa un vistazo a nuestra aventura opcional de vacaciones de primavera organizada por nuestro propio Departamento de Servicios Educativos aqu:

div.p: The CDC and state and local public health departments are continuing to closely monitor new developments regarding the Novel Coronavirus outbreak.

a.title: Go to comments for CORONAVIRUS INFORMATION

div.p: Key topics include: Appointment of Superintendent

a.title: Go to comments for SPECIAL BOARD MEETING 04/09/20-CLOSED SESSION ONLY

div.p: Key topics include: Specifically Designating Public Works Project(s) As Essential Government Functions

a.title: Go to comments for EMERGENCY BOARD MEETING 04/02/20

div.p: Elementary science and reading language arts proposed instructional materials are available for review online.

a.title: Go to comments for PUBLIC HEARING 04/02/20

div.p: Key topics include: public hearings for increasing developer fees, adoption of grades 4-5 English and Language Arts curriculum, adoption of grades K-5 Mystery Science curriculum and approval of MOU with CSEA

a.title: Go to comments for BOARD MEETING 04/02/20

img.alt: empty school district board room with dais and chairs and microphones

div.p: Key topics include: Employee appointment/discussion regarding the superintendent

a.title: Go to comments for SPECIAL BOARD MEETING 03/27/20 (CLOSED SESSION ONLY)

img.alt: typewriter special message from the superintendent

div.p: Please check this webpage for ongoing updates and important announcements regarding this process.

a.title: Go to comments for Superintendent Search Webpage

img.alt: green learn today lead tomorrow seedling logo

a.span: December Message: Helping all children become enthusiastic proponents of their own learning journeys

div.p: I think being an educator is the best job in the world. We have the rare honor of helping children develop from curious school newcomers to confident, sophisticated learners.

a.title: Go to comments for December Message: Helping all children become enthusiastic proponents of their own learning journeys

a.span: September Message: The power of story

div.p: Children need to know that their stories have value, just as they themselves are innately and immeasurably valuable.

a.title: Go to comments for September Message: The power of story

div.p: It has been an honor and joy to serve this district, students, and families, for all of these many years.

a.title: Go to comments for Retirement Message

span.a: Special Board of Education Development Meeting
TK-5 Early Dismissal - Teacher Learning Day
